name: é’é“œçºµç›®é¢å…·
descriptionEN: It measures 138 centimeters in width and 66 centimeters in height. The eyeballs are exaggerated and protrude like columns, extending 16 centimeters from the eye sockets. The large ears spread out prominently, and there is a square hole in the middle of the forehead. This feature may be related to the legend of the first generation of Shu kings, Can Cong, as described in ancient documents having "protruding eyes.

name: é’é“œå¤§é¢å…·
descriptionEN: The bronze mask, measuring 132 centimeters in width and 72 centimeters in height, is one of the largest among the masks of its kind found at Sanxingdui. This mask was cast in two stages, with the head and face being cast in molds, and the two ears being connected by the method of inlay casting. There is a square hole in the middle of the forehead, and it is estimated that there were originally decorative pieces cast in place.
